item.title: Allyson add a quote by Roberto Bolaño
item.description: "So everything lets us down, including curiosity and honesty and what we love best. Yes, said the voice, but cheer up, it's fun in the end." -- Roberto Bolaño

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "Intrepid then, o'er seas and lands he flew: Europe he saw, and Europe saw him too." -- Alexander Pope

item.title: Allyson add a quote by D. H. Lawrence
item.description: "Perhaps only people who are capable of real togetherness have that look of being alone in the universe. The others have a certain stickiness, they stick to the mass." -- D. H. Lawrence

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Wilkie Collins
item.description: "My hour for tea is half-past five, and my buttered toast waits for nobody." -- Wilkie Collins

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "In her novel Regeneration, Pat Barker writes of a doctor who 'knew only too well how often the early stages of change or cure may mimic deterioration. Cut a chrysalis open, and you will find a rotting caterpillar. What you will never find is that mythical creature, half caterpillar, half butterfly, a fit emblem of the human soul, for those whose cast of mind leads them to seek such emblems. No, the process of transformation consists almost entirely of decay." -- Rebecca Solnit
